function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of regular cleaning and maintenance of HVAC systems can lead to the buildup of dirt, mold, and other contaminants, increasing the risk of spreading contagious diseases through the air.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission of contagious diseases within the building.","Mitigation":"Establish and adhere to a strict schedule for the regular cleaning and maintenance of HVAC systems, including filter changes and thorough cleaning of components.","Technologies":"Advanced cleaning equipment and procedures, HEPA filtration, negative pressure systems.","People":"Building occupants, visitors, workers.","Owner":"Building management, professional cleaning companies."},{"Description":"Inadequate handling of dirty filters during replacement can lead to the spread of biologic particles, including molds, bacteria, and viruses, posing a risk of contamination to individuals involved in maintenance activities.","Impact":"Potential exposure of maintenance personnel to harmful biologic particles during filter replacement.","Mitigation":"Provide proper training and equipment for safe filter replacement, including gloves, respirators, masks, and disposal procedures for dirty filters.","Technologies":"HEPA filtration, personal protective equipment (PPE).","People":"Maintenance personnel, building occupants.","Owner":"Building management, maintenance staff."},{"Description":"Reentrainment of exhausted effluents into the HVAC system due to engineering problems can result in the spread of contaminants and increase the risk of airborne transmission of diseases.","Impact":"Higher chances of airborne transmission of contaminants and contagious diseases within the building.","Mitigation":"Conduct regular inspections and maintenance of HVAC systems to prevent or identify reentrainment issues. Implement engineering changes if necessary to mitigate reentrainment risks.","Technologies":"Advanced engineering solutions, regular system inspections.","People":"Building occupants, visitors, workers.","Owner":"Building management, engineering team."}]}
